context: I have very large hands, how will this mouse work out with that? I prefer palm grip, and most mice force me to use claw because they are too small.

context: the thumb buttons, are they mechanical or membrane?
response: I can't say with certainty that the first two posts are incorrect, but they do not feel mechanical to me.  The tactile feedback on them is extremely poor, and there's virtually no auditory feedback to speak of.  The primary buttons (on the top) are definitely mechanical, but I really doubt the ones on the side are.

context: What does it mean by "selective DPI?" For instance, are you able to have 2500 DPI? Or just 1,000, 2,000, 4,000 etc..
response: It has the widest range I've ever seen in a mouse from 150 to 16400. You can set it to any number in that range, that the cursor can land on, usually 50 or 00. IE: You wont be able to get 1758 but you can get 1700 1750 or 1800 depending on where the setting lands

context: does this come with the rechargable batteris?
response: No it's just a charging dock. You would have to buy the rechargeable batteries separate. It's worth purchasing.

context: does anyone know if this will work in the xbox 360 E
response: Yes, but the drive won't play older games

context: Does the system come with the game where the bunny chases carrots?
response: No, there are no games with the bundle.

context: Will this work on a Windows PC or not?
response: I bought this product several months ago and tried it on my computer. The software is somewhat compatible but ultimately this controller is not meant for Windows PC. Your best bet would be to buy a brand-name Xbox controller from microsoft

context: Is there a Micro SD card port to add content (music files, etc.); and could I download to the console from Google Play, etc?
response: I asked my teenage son who uses it and he said YES to both of your questions.  ;)

context: Does this require a eye camera?
response: I'm shure it dose need one I bought both

context: Is it okay for an eight year old? I worry about language.
response: I have it and don't think I have ever heard any found language while playing this game.

context: I want a cd that I can download to my pc and not have to interact with other sites and don't have ads - just a icon my husband can click on & play?
response: That's all he has to do is click the icon.  No ads to bother you.

context: I am purchasing equipment for an Oculus Rift that will be released next year. Does this work well for first person games? I know only WASD.
response: That depends, yes it will work with first person games but the limitation is how many keys you need, if the game requires more hotkeys than are available on the gaming pad than you will still need your keyboard to use all the functions.

context: Does this work with the Skyrim Legendary PC game?
response: Some games don't have controller support, but it should say. Go into setting/options on Skyrim main menu and see if there is controller support, if not then it's a keyboard only game.

context: Am i suppose to recieve a spliter for the fan? Because as of now, the male is 3 prong and the female is 4.
response: It's been over a year since I installed this on my elite. What little I remember is that everything matched up fine. Maybe different versions have different fan plugs? Hopefully someone here has opened up several original model 360s to verify this.

context: Is this product for lefthanders?
response: I think it would be uncomfortable for a left hander'

context: Does Wolfenstein:TNO have a single player mode?
response: Yes Chuck this a single player 1st person shooter game.Old school. There is no group play option.

context: Is there a risk of over charging the batteries and shortening their lifespan?
response: No, this charger stops when the controls is completly chargeds

context: Does this game work on the Surface 2
response: No, it requires a laptop or computer.

context: Is this game the same as the definitive edition, content wise?
response: Pretty much the same. The only difference is the high-res, next-gen graphics on the Definitive Edition. If you just want to play the game and enjoy the story, then the 360 version is good enough!

context: Is this the whole game or just a code for items?
response: Yes this is the entire game.

context: If I get this without the Kinect, can I buy a Kinect and add it on later or am I stuck with the Kinectless version?
response: You can add it later, when they release the kinect separately.

context: Is the flap control a 3-way rotating lever, or an up/middle/down switch? I currently use one of the levers from a throttle quadrant as a flap control.
response: It is only a two way lever, up and down.

context: What exactly comes with the System(aside from a controller) Do I get all the cables needed?(aside from HDMI) Anything to I need to buy separately?
response: Yes, it comes with the basic cables needed in order to operate the system. The only extras you need are the ones you just want to have.

context: how long is the battery life?
response: Not really sure, but I wouldn't really recommend this mouse considering price and compared to my ROCCAT XTD it reks this thing. Not trying to sway you just informing you that you should definitely decide whether you really really want this mouse or not because it doesn't seem very good from my experience with it

context: Is this a 4 player offline game?
response: I definitely played with one other person. However, I am not sure if you could play with up to 4 people offline. I am not sure how the game would handle 4 people playing in the same area going in 4 different directions.

context: can the galaxy s5 fit in this gamepad?
response: I have the note 3 it fits snug so yes it should fit easily

context: This is to make the graphics better correct?
response: Yes and certain games like mine craft need it to use multi player

context: Is this good for people with big heads?
response: It can extend, but big ears no

context: Is it touch screen display?
response: The bottom screen is touch sensitive

context: How big is the USB dongle?
response: VERY small... laying flat down it is about 1 cm tall, 3/4" long and half an inch in depth. Like a beefed of Frito. It basically just pokes out of the USB slot EVER so slightly, about 2 cm.

context: is it good for hearing the steps in black ops? please be honest
response: My son uses it to play black ops and doesn't seem to have ant problems hearing it.
